title: Is it a crime to pursue simultaneously two degrees from distance and another from regular mode? What action does the government take? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would hardly see pursuing two degrees to be a crime. It may take up a lot of time and be expensive, but unless there are some rules or regulations in your home country that prevent it, I cannot believe it would be. In some locations, only people with certain visas are eligible for study. Also, the amount of subsidy or lending available from the government will depend on an individual person’s past qualifications, either completed or not completed. If you have some concerns, talk to the education providers and look at their websites for further information. As far as I know, if you are paying full fees, they don’t usually care! It is good to see that you value education - just don’t overdo it and burn yourself out. Study is important, but so is experience. Please let me know if this has been helpful to you. Sue Ellson - Careers and Business Specialist
